intro: Adenodus sylvestris, commonly known as the forest adenodus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems, typical of many species in its family. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments, such as rainforests. The leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface, contributing to its adaptability in dense vegetation.
